text: The middle school where Mr. Bernoski teaches is raising money to make improvements to the recreation center. Each grade picks a different fund-raising activity. They designate one day to raise money.

The 6th grade class sells Smoothie Bars.

  • A Smoothie Bar sells for $5 each.
  • It costs $15.50 for refrigeration to keep the bars cold.
  • They spend $25.50 on advertising.

They sell 100 bars.

The 7th grade washes cars.

  • They charge $8 a car.
  • The costs for supplies are $ 29.50.
  • They spend $35.25 on advertising.

They wash 50 cars.

The 8th grade sells digital recordings of the school musical.

  • They charge $7 per recording.
  • The cost to make the recordings is $155.75.
  • They spend $30.50 on advertising.

They sell 25 recordings.
For each activity explain if each grade will make a profit or a loss. Show your work.
